page.title: 01Telscombe Cliffs Today
page.content: Telscombe Cliffs is a small seaside residential area. Most people find employment in neighbouring Peacehaven or the bigger towns of Brighton and Newhaven.In the last three years there has been a rapid increase in housing developments, much land previously classed as greenbelt has now been built on, but there is little sign of a similiar growth in amenities such as health centres,youth clubs etc.The local school is full with all classes the maximum allowed size.The sea al- though accessable is not ideal for bathing as sewage from here, Saltdean, Rottingdean and Brighton is pumped in to it.The original Victorian sewers are still used when the newly built system breaks down.The nearest cross Channel port is Newhaven 4 miles east & Brighton the nearest major entertain ment centre is 7 miles to the west.
